1.0	Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies

The City of Edmond Water Resources Edmond Water Resource Recovery Facility is committed to the safety of our workers, the public, and the environment. The resources invested in the prevention of accidental releases of hazardous substances demonstrate this commitment. The City of Edmond Water Resources Edmond Water Resource Recovery Facility implements reasonable controls, such as training of personnel and the safe design, installation, operation and maintenance of our processes. Our policy is to make every effort to prevent the release of hazardous substances but in the event of a release, our trained personnel and local emergency response agencies will respond to control and contain the release in a manner that will be safe for workers and will help prevent injuries to the public or the environment.

2.0 Description of The City of Edmond Water Resources Edmond Water Resource Recovery Facility and Regulated Substances

The City of Edmond Water Resources Edmond Water Resource Recovery Facility handles two substances regulated by the Risk Management Plan Rule (RMP Rule) in quantities above the Threshold Quantity. These substances are:

* Chlorine - stored in 1 ton cylinders and used for chlorination of the water.
* Sulfur dioxide- stored in 1 ton cylinders and used for sulfonation of water.

3.0 Hazard Assessment

The RMP Rule requires The City of Edmond Water Resources Edmond Water Resource Recovery Facility to perform a Hazard Assessment of the regulated substances stored and used in the covered processes at the facility. 4.4 Training

The City of Edmond Water Resources Edmond Water Resource Recovery Facility trains personnel in the operating procedures to help ensure safe and effective performance of their assigned tasks. 4.5 Maintenance 

The City of Edmond Water Resources Edmond Water Resource Recovery Facility properly maintains the equipment in our processes. The City of Edmond Water Resources Edmond Water Resource Recovery Facility maintenance program includes:

1. procedures to safely guide workers in their maintenance tasks,
2. worker training in the maintenance procedures, and
3. inspection and testing program to help identify equipment deterioration and damage before equipment fails.

4.6 Compliance Audits

The City of Edmond Water Resources Edmond Water Resource Recovery Facility performs periodic (at least every three years) audits of covered processes to verify the processes are operating in compliance with the requirements of the RMP Rule. A compliance audit report is prepared after each audit, and any deficiencies noted by the audit are corrected in a timely manner.

4.7 Incident Investigations

The City of Edmond Water Resources Edmond Water Resource Recovery Facility investigates all incidents that could reasonably have resulted in a serious injury to personnel, the public, or the environment. 4.8 Chemical-specific Prevention Steps - Process chemicals

Industry standards are followed at The City of Edmond Water Resources Edmond Water Resource Recovery Facility to help ensure safe handling of process chemicals. The vendor supplies chlorine and sulfur dioxide via a Department of Transportation (DOT) approved truck and in DOT approved 1 ton cylinders. The process equipment is designed and constructed with state-of-the-art materials and technology utilizing the standards and guidelines of the Chlorine Institute, American Water Works Association, ASME, ANSI, and other applicable codes. Workers who perform operations involving chlorine and sulfur dioxide receive training emphasizing safe handling procedures according to the guidelines required by The City of Edmond Water Resources Edmond Water Resource Recovery Facility.

5.0 Five Year Accident History
There has been no accidents or incidents that resulted in injuries to employee, the public, or the environment The City of Edmond Water Resources Edmond Water Resource Recovery Facility in the past five years.

6.0 Emergency Action Plan

The City of Edmond Water Resources Edmond Water Resource Recovery Facility has prepared a written emergency action plan that complies with the RMP Rule, other federal standards and industry guidelines. This plan has been communicated to the Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) and local fire department. The City of Edmond Water Resources Edmond Water Resource Recovery Facility periodically conducts emergency drills to test our emergency plan and coordinate these drills with the local fire department.
